Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
04/17/2018. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for
the following:
R 400.4111 Job description.
An institution shall provide a job description for each staff
position that identifies rules, required qualifications, and lines of
authority.
Two out of 29 applicable new employee records reviewed did not contain verification
of a job description.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
Three out of eight employee records having worked more than one year had late or
a missing annual central registry checks. One record contained a late check by 49
days, whereas the second record was 22 days late. The third record’s last central
registry check occurred on 09/27/2016 and no verification of an updated check was
on file.
REPEAT CITATION FROM 05/19/2017 INTERIM INSPECTION
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
4

180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
Seven out of 29 applicable employee records reviewed contained late or missing
performance evaluations. One employees performance evaluation was two months
late, whereas six did not contain an evaluation completed after their probationary
period.
REPEAT CITATION FROM 05/19/2017 INTERIM INSPECTION
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Three out of eight employee records having worked more than one year had late or
a missing TB tests. One record was late with an updated TB test by two months,
whereas the second record was less than one month late. The last record was last
checked for TB on 04/06/2016 and verification of an updated test was not on file.
REPEAT CITATION FROM 05/19/2017 INTERIM INSPECTION
R 400.41156 First aid; CPR
A person certified within the preceding 36 months in first aid and
within the preceding 24 months in age-appropriate
cardiopulmonary resuscitation by the American Red Cross, the
American Heart Association, or an equivalent organization or
institution approved by the department shall be on duty at all
times when 1 or more children are present.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
The facility has staff that required chest x-rays for TB screening at time of hire.
Annual TB testing verification through chest x-rays is not medically recommended.
The facility will need to comply with the written DCWL technical assistance regarding
annual documentation verifying the staff person’s knowledge of signs and
symptoms.

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted six acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The facility submitted a corrective action plan for the 05/19/2017 interim inspection
report. It appropriately addressed the following as no repeat citations are noted:
Central registry check prior to employment, completion of updated service plans,
discharge summaries indicating services provided by the agency after discharge,
documenting discharge recommendations being reviewed for short term residents,
and discharge recommendations being reviewed for residential discharge cases.
Repeat citations include: timely completion of annual central registries, staff
performance evaluations, timely completion of annual TB testing, supervisor signature
on treatment plans, and uploading medical documents into MiSACWIS.
SIR#2017C0219056 initiated on 08/18/2017 resulted in the facility being cited for staff
qualifications and the facility’s program statement regarding professional boundaries
in which staff engaged in a relationship with a resident shortly after discharge and
resigning from the facility. The corrective action plan included unannounced PREA
rounds and interviews, monthly staff refresher trainings in PREA standards and
annual PREA training, as well as requesting a PREA compliance assessment. A
repeat citation with professional boundaries is noted, though not to the extent as this
investigation results. It is also noted that the repeat citation occurred prior to the
implementation of the current corrective action plan.
SIR#2018C0219001 initiated on 10/02/2017 resulted in the facility being cited for
program statement regarding contractual requirements regarding treatment reports
being generated in MiSACWIS. The corrective action plan was successful as all
treatment reports have been generated in MiSACWIS.
SIR#2018C0219006 initiated on 10/25/2017 resulted in the facility being cited for
program statement regarding professional boundaries when a staff member wrote a
letter to a resident while still in placement, as well as staff failing to report resident
behaviors and marks. The corrective action plan included unannounced PREA
rounds and interviews, as well as weekly training regarding reporting. This is a repeat
citation though occurred prior to the implementation of the previous corrective action
plan.
SIR#2018C0219012 initiated on 12/13/2017 resulted in the facility being cited for
appropriate restraint technique when staff extended his arm outward as resident ran
at staff causing the resident to fall, as well as placement in seclusion when not
warranted. The corrective action plan included staff being retrained in Handle with
Care techniques and appropriate use of seclusion. The seclusion portion of the CAP
10

was successful as no additional seclusion citations are noted, whereas one repeat
citation occurred in regards to restraint technique.
SIR#2018C021935 initiated on 03/29/2018 resulted in the facility being cited for
restraint technique due to a resident grabbing hold of a staff and the two grappling
each other in an unapproved technique. The corrective action plan included staff
suspension, individualized processing of the incident, as well as staff training in
restraint training. This is a repeat citation within the reporting period though the
restraint technique citations differ.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
